it.apice.sapere.node.agents
Interface SAPEREAgentsFactory

All Known Implementing Classes:
SAPEREAgentsFactoryImpl
public interface SAPEREAgentsFactory

This interface models a service capable of creating (local) SAPEREAgents on a SAPERE-node.

Author:
Paolo Contessi

Method Summary
 SAPEREAgent createAgent(String agentLocalId, SAPEREAgentSpec spec)
           Creates a new SAPEREAgent and binds it to this SAPERE-node or retrieves the homonyomus one.
 SAPEREAgent createSysAgent(String agentLocalId, SAPERESysAgentSpec spec)
           Creates an agent like createAgent(String, SAPEREAgentSpec), but with FULL ACCESS TO NODE SERVICES.
 SAPEREAgent getAgent(String agentLocalId)
           Retrieves a previously created agent on this SAPERE-node.
 void killAll()
           Kills all SAPEREAgents.
 

Method Detail

createAgent

SAPEREAgent createAgent(String agentLocalId,
                        SAPEREAgentSpec spec)
                        throws SAPEREException

Creates a new SAPEREAgent and binds it to this SAPERE-node or retrieves the homonyomus one.

If the agent has been already created then the provided behaviour specification is ignored. In this case the getAgent(String) method should be preferred.

Parameters:
agentLocalId - The local name of the agent (a URI fragment)
spec - The agent behaviour specification
Returns:
The SAPEREAgent, linked to the node
Throws:
SAPEREException - Invalid agentId

getAgent

SAPEREAgent getAgent(String agentLocalId)
                     throws SAPEREException

Retrieves a previously created agent on this SAPERE-node.

Parameters:
agentLocalId - The local name of the agent (a URI fragment)
Returns:
The SAPEREAgent
Throws:
SAPEREException - Invalid agentId

createSysAgent

SAPEREAgent createSysAgent(String agentLocalId,
                           SAPERESysAgentSpec spec)
                           throws SAPEREException

Creates an agent like createAgent(String, SAPEREAgentSpec), but with FULL ACCESS TO NODE SERVICES.

THIS METHOD SHOULD BE HIDDEN WHEN LSA MODEL SUPPORT IS PROVIDED.

Parameters:
agentLocalId - The local name of the agent (a URI fragment)
spec - The agent behaviour specification
Returns:
The SAPEREAgent, linked to the node
Throws:
SAPEREException - Invalid agentId

killAll

void killAll()

Kills all SAPEREAgents.
